answers.answer: Medical services for pregnant women are managed at different levels, including Primary medical assistance, Specialized ambulatory medical assistance for paraclinical specialties, and Specialized ambulatory medical assistance for clinical specialties.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'The medical services provided to pregnant women are managed on different levels as follows'.

answers.answer: Primary medical assistance supports pregnant women through consultations for monitoring pregnancy and labor, promoting breastfeeding, and providing testing for HIV and hepatitis. It also includes supervision of labor without giving birth and unexpected birth services, which can be provided by a family doctor.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Primary medical assistance'.

answers.answer: Family doctors issue the document certifying the existence of pregnancy during the pregnant woman's first appointment with them.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Primary medical assistance'.

answers.answer: Recommended tests include HIV, hepatitis B and C, complete blood count, blood group determination, serum urea, uric acid, creatinine, blood glucose, TGP, TGO, TSH, complete urine examination, VDRL or RPR, and evaluation for infections like rubella, toxoplasmosis, and CMV.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Specialized ambulatory medical assistance for clinical specialties'.

answers.answer: Paraclinical medical services included are Papanicolau cervico-vaginal cytological examination, examinations of vaginal secretions (native and colored microscopic examination for bacterial and fungal identification), Antibiogram, and Antifungigram.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Specialized ambulatory medical assistance for paraclinical specialties'.

answers.answer: Obstetrical ultrasounds for first and second-trimester anomalies are covered by FNUASS only when performed by doctors specializing in obstetrics-gynecology with overspecialization in maternal-fetal medicine.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Specialized ambulatory medical assistance for paraclinical specialties'.

answers.answer: Services for normal pregnancy supervision include one consultation for each trimester and one after birth, along with mandatory services such as specialist consultations, various blood and urine tests, HIV testing, infection evaluations, and a confirmation ultrasound for pregnancy viability.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Specialized ambulatory medical assistance for clinical specialties'.

answers.answer: Prenatal screening involves mandatory services including an Obstetrics-gynecology specialist consultation for result interpretation, a Double or Triple test, and an ultrasound to detect fetal anomalies.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Prenatal screening (S11 - S19 + 6 days)'.

answers.answer: High-risk pregnancy surveillance covers conditions like gestational oedema, mild hyperemesis gravidarum, and scarred uterus, involving services such as specialist consultations, various blood and urine tests, ultrasound, cardiotocography, and specific electrolyte or protein measurements depending on the condition.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Surveillance of other high-risk pregnancies'.

answers.answer: High-risk pregnancies with coagulation disorders or thrombophilias are monitored through mandatory services including specialist consultations, specific blood tests like Antithrombin III, Protein C, Protein S, serum hemocysteine dosage, Factor V Leyden, Lupus anticoagulant screening/confirmation, and obstetric and gynecological ultrasound.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'high-risk pregnancy monitoring in pregnant women with coagulation disorders / hereditary and acquired thrombophilias'.

answers.answer: Specific invasive procedures covered during pregnancy include chorionic villus biopsy, amniocentesis, and cordocentesis, which can be performed during day hospitalization. Genetic testing of samples taken from these procedures is also included.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Amniocentesis, cordocentesis, and chorionic villus biopsy services'.

answers.answer: Chorionic villus biopsy is covered in the first trimester, and amniocentesis in the second trimester, for cases with confirmed major anomalies or genetic pathology risk, or aneuploidy risk greater than 1/250. Both must be performed by specialized doctors.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Amniocentesis, cordocentesis, and chorionic villus biopsy services'.

answers.answer: Medical services typically provided in day hospitalization can also be offered under continuous hospitalization if the patient experiences complications, comorbidities, major bleeding, difficult-to-manage anesthetic risk, or uncontrollable post-procedural pain.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'The medical services provided in the day hospitalization regime'.

answers.answer: Pregnancy services are provided by obstetrics-gynecology specialty hospitals and other health units with beds that have obstetrics-gynecology and neonatology departments or sections ranked at levels 1, 2, or 3. Some services also require the unit to have an obstetrics-gynecology office and a medical analysis laboratory.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The Women's Center offers support for accessing reproductive health services like contraception, breastfeeding, STD prevention, pregnancy monitoring, and abortion, as well as assistance in navigating the health system and services for victims of domestic violence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Women's Center'.
